title: Fire of the Land
viewing_guidelines: Aboriginal and Islander viewers should note this work may contain images of deceased people and caution should be exercised when viewing.
subject_group: Economics, Philosophy, Politics, Religion & Sociology/Social justice
abstract: A unique moment in Aboriginal Protest history
description: Prior to the Sydney 2000 Olympics, ashes from a sacred aboriginal fire were taken to Victoria Park Sydney establishing the Aboriginal Tent Embassy, peace camp. Fire of the Land is the story of the Embassy's campaign to get international recognition for Aboriginal sovereignty, capturing an unique moment in Aboriginal Protest history.
part_of_compliation_title_or_vod_package: Compilation title; B2000619; AFTRS Indigenous student productions collection; Active; 1989-2005
active_carriers_public_types_and_formats: MOV file H264; ACMI Digital Access Copy - presentation
